04290         };
04291 
04292         typedef CLARA_AUTO_PTR( Arg ) ArgAutoPtr;
04293 
04294         friend void addOptName( Arg& arg, std::string const& optName )
04295         {
04296             if( optName.empty() )
04297                 return;
04298             if( Detail::startsWith( optName, "--" ) ) {
04299                 if( !arg.longName.empty() )
04300                     throw std::logic_error( "Only one long opt may be specified. '"
04301                         + arg.longName
04302                         + "' already specified, now attempting to add '"
04303                         + optName + "'" );
04304                 arg.longName = optName.substr( 2 );
04305             }
04306             else if( Detail::startsWith( optName, "-" ) )
04307                 arg.shortNames.push_back( optName.substr( 1 ) );
04308             else
04309                 throw std::logic_error( "option must begin with - or --. Option was: '" + optName + "'" );
04310         }
04311         friend void setPositionalArg( Arg& arg, int position )
04312         {
04313             arg.position = position;
04314         }
04315 
04316         class ArgBuilder {
04317         public:
04318             ArgBuilder( Arg* arg ) : m_arg( arg ) {}
04319 
04320             // Bind a non-boolean data member (requires placeholder string)
04321             template<typename C, typename M>
04322             void bind( M C::* field, std::string const& placeholder ) {
04323                 m_arg->boundField = new Detail::BoundDataMember<C,M>( field );
04324                 m_arg->placeholder = placeholder;
04325             }
04326             // Bind a boolean data member (no placeholder required)
04327             template<typename C>
04328             void bind( bool C::* field ) {
04329                 m_arg->boundField = new Detail::BoundDataMember<C,bool>( field );
04330             }
04331 
04332             // Bind a method taking a single, non-boolean argument (requires a placeholder string)
04333             template<typename C, typename M>
04334             void bind( void (C::* unaryMethod)( M ), std::string const& placeholder ) {
04335                 m_arg->boundField = new Detail::BoundUnaryMethod<C,M>( unaryMethod );
04336                 m_arg->placeholder = placeholder;
04337             }
04338 
04339             // Bind a method taking a single, boolean argument (no placeholder string required)
04340             template<typename C>
04341             void bind( void (C::* unaryMethod)( bool ) ) {
04342                 m_arg->boundField = new Detail::BoundUnaryMethod<C,bool>( unaryMethod );
04343             }
04344 
04345             // Bind a method that takes no arguments (will be called if opt is present)
04346             template<typename C>
04347             void bind( void (C::* nullaryMethod)() ) {
04348                 m_arg->boundField = new Detail::BoundNullaryMethod<C>( nullaryMethod );
04349             }
04350 
04351             // Bind a free function taking a single argument - the object to operate on (no placeholder string required)
04352             template<typename C>
04353             void bind( void (* unaryFunction)( C& ) ) {
04354                 m_arg->boundField = new Detail::BoundUnaryFunction<C>( unaryFunction );
04355             }
04356 
04357             // Bind a free function taking a single argument - the object to operate on (requires a placeholder string)
04358             template<typename C, typename T>
04359             void bind( void (* binaryFunction)( C&, T ), std::string const& placeholder ) {
04360                 m_arg->boundField = new Detail::BoundBinaryFunction<C, T>( binaryFunction );
04361                 m_arg->placeholder = placeholder;
04362             }
04363 
04364             ArgBuilder& describe( std::string const& description ) {
04365                 m_arg->description = description;
04366                 return *this;
04367             }
04368             ArgBuilder& detail( std::string const& detail ) {
04369                 m_arg->detail = detail;
04370                 return *this;
04371             }
04372 
04373         protected:
04374             Arg* m_arg;
04375         };
04376 
04377         class OptBuilder : public ArgBuilder {
04378         public:
04379             OptBuilder( Arg* arg ) : ArgBuilder( arg ) {}
04380             OptBuilder( OptBuilder& other ) : ArgBuilder( other ) {}
04381 
04382             OptBuilder& operator[]( std::string const& optName ) {
04383                 addOptName( *ArgBuilder::m_arg, optName );
04384                 return *this;
04385             }
04386         };
04387 
04388     public:
04389 
04390         CommandLine()
04391         :   m_boundProcessName( new Detail::NullBinder<ConfigT>() ),
04392             m_highestSpecifiedArgPosition( 0 ),
04393             m_throwOnUnrecognisedTokens( false )
04394         {}
04395         CommandLine( CommandLine const& other )
04396         :   m_boundProcessName( other.m_boundProcessName ),
04397             m_options ( other.m_options ),
04398             m_positionalArgs( other.m_positionalArgs ),
04399             m_highestSpecifiedArgPosition( other.m_highestSpecifiedArgPosition ),
04400             m_throwOnUnrecognisedTokens( other.m_throwOnUnrecognisedTokens )
04401         {
04402             if( other.m_floatingArg.get() )
04403                 m_floatingArg.reset( new Arg( *other.m_floatingArg ) );
04404         }
04405 
04406         CommandLine& setThrowOnUnrecognisedTokens( bool shouldThrow = true ) {
04407             m_throwOnUnrecognisedTokens = shouldThrow;
04408             return *this;
04409         }
04410 
04411         OptBuilder operator[]( std::string const& optName ) {
04412             m_options.push_back( Arg() );
04413             addOptName( m_options.back(), optName );
04414             OptBuilder builder( &m_options.back() );
04415             return builder;
04416         }
04417 
04418         ArgBuilder operator[]( int position ) {
04419             m_positionalArgs.insert( std::make_pair( position, Arg() ) );
04420             if( position > m_highestSpecifiedArgPosition )
04421                 m_highestSpecifiedArgPosition = position;
04422             setPositionalArg( m_positionalArgs[position], position );
04423             ArgBuilder builder( &m_positionalArgs[position] );
04424             return builder;
04425         }
04426 
04427         // Invoke this with the _ instance
04428         ArgBuilder operator[]( UnpositionalTag ) {
04429             if( m_floatingArg.get() )
04430                 throw std::logic_error( "Only one unpositional argument can be added" );
04431             m_floatingArg.reset( new Arg() );
04432             ArgBuilder builder( m_floatingArg.get() );
04433             return builder;
04434         }
04435 
04436         template<typename C, typename M>
04437         void bindProcessName( M C::* field ) {
04438             m_boundProcessName = new Detail::BoundDataMember<C,M>( field );
04439         }
04440         template<typename C, typename M>
04441         void bindProcessName( void (C::*_unaryMethod)( M ) ) {
04442             m_boundProcessName = new Detail::BoundUnaryMethod<C,M>( _unaryMethod );
04443         }
04444 
04445         void optUsage( std::ostream& os, std::size_t indent = 0, std::size_t width = Detail::consoleWidth ) const {
04446             typename std::vector<Arg>::const_iterator itBegin = m_options.begin(), itEnd = m_options.end(), it;
04447             std::size_t maxWidth = 0;
04448             for( it = itBegin; it != itEnd; ++it )
04449                 maxWidth = (std::max)( maxWidth, it->commands().size() );
04450 
04451             for( it = itBegin; it != itEnd; ++it ) {
04452                 Detail::Text usage( it->commands(), Detail::TextAttributes()
04453                                                         .setWidth( maxWidth+indent )
04454                                                         .setIndent( indent ) );
04455                 Detail::Text desc( it->description, Detail::TextAttributes()
04456                                                         .setWidth( width - maxWidth - 3 ) );
04457 
04458                 for( std::size_t i = 0; i < (std::max)( usage.size(), desc.size() ); ++i ) {
04459                     std::string usageCol = i < usage.size() ? usage[i] : "";
04460                     os << usageCol;
04461 
04462                     if( i < desc.size() && !desc[i].empty() )
04463                         os  << std::string( indent + 2 + maxWidth - usageCol.size(), ' ' )
04464                             << desc[i];
04465                     os << "\n";
04466                 }
04467             }
04468         }
04469         std::string optUsage() const {
04470             std::ostringstream oss;
04471             optUsage( oss );
04472             return oss.str();
04473         }
04474 
04475         void argSynopsis( std::ostream& os ) const {
04476             for( int i = 1; i <= m_highestSpecifiedArgPosition; ++i ) {
04477                 if( i > 1 )
04478                     os << " ";
04479                 typename std::map<int, Arg>::const_iterator it = m_positionalArgs.find( i );
04480                 if( it != m_positionalArgs.end() )
04481                     os << "<" << it->second.placeholder << ">";
04482                 else if( m_floatingArg.get() )
04483                     os << "<" << m_floatingArg->placeholder << ">";
04484                 else
04485                     throw std::logic_error( "non consecutive positional arguments with no floating args" );
04486             }
04487             // !TBD No indication of mandatory args
04488             if( m_floatingArg.get() ) {
04489                 if( m_highestSpecifiedArgPosition > 1 )
04490                     os << " ";
04491                 os << "[<" << m_floatingArg->placeholder << "> ...]";
04492             }
04493         }
04494         std::string argSynopsis() const {
04495             std::ostringstream oss;
04496             argSynopsis( oss );
04497             return oss.str();
04498         }
04499 
04500         void usage( std::ostream& os, std::string const& procName ) const {
04501             validate();
04502             os << "usage:\n  " << procName << " ";
04503             argSynopsis( os );
04504             if( !m_options.empty() ) {
04505                 os << " [options]\n\nwhere options are: \n";
04506                 optUsage( os, 2 );
04507             }
04508             os << "\n";
04509         }
04510         std::string usage( std::string const& procName ) const {
04511             std::ostringstream oss;
04512             usage( oss, procName );
04513             return oss.str();
04514         }
04515 
04516         ConfigT parse( std::vector<std::string> const& args ) const {
04517             ConfigT config;
04518             parseInto( args, config );
04519             return config;
04520         }
04521 
04522         std::vector<Parser::Token> parseInto( std::vector<std::string> const& args, ConfigT& config ) const {
04523             std::string processName = args[0];
04524             std::size_t lastSlash = processName.find_last_of( "/\\" );
04525             if( lastSlash != std::string::npos )
04526                 processName = processName.substr( lastSlash+1 );
04527             m_boundProcessName.set( config, processName );
04528             std::vector<Parser::Token> tokens;
04529             Parser parser;
04530             parser.parseIntoTokens( args, tokens );
04531             return populate( tokens, config );
04532         }
04533 
04534         std::vector<Parser::Token> populate( std::vector<Parser::Token> const& tokens, ConfigT& config ) const {
04535             validate();
04536             std::vector<Parser::Token> unusedTokens = populateOptions( tokens, config );
04537             unusedTokens = populateFixedArgs( unusedTokens, config );
04538             unusedTokens = populateFloatingArgs( unusedTokens, config );
04539             return unusedTokens;
04540         }
04541 
04542         std::vector<Parser::Token> populateOptions( std::vector<Parser::Token> const& tokens, ConfigT& config ) const {
04543             std::vector<Parser::Token> unusedTokens;
04544             std::vector<std::string> errors;
04545             for( std::size_t i = 0; i < tokens.size(); ++i ) {
04546                 Parser::Token const& token = tokens[i];
04547                 typename std::vector<Arg>::const_iterator it = m_options.begin(), itEnd = m_options.end();
04548                 for(; it != itEnd; ++it ) {
04549                     Arg const& arg = *it;
04550 
04551                     try {
04552                         if( ( token.type == Parser::Token::ShortOpt && arg.hasShortName( token.data ) ) ||
04553                             ( token.type == Parser::Token::LongOpt && arg.hasLongName( token.data ) ) ) {
04554                             if( arg.takesArg() ) {
04555                                 if( i == tokens.size()-1 || tokens[i+1].type != Parser::Token::Positional )
04556                                     errors.push_back( "Expected argument to option: " + token.data );
04557                                 else
04558                                     arg.boundField.set( config, tokens[++i].data );
04559                             }
04560                             else {
04561                                 arg.boundField.set( config, "true" );
04562                             }
04563                             break;
04564                         }
04565                     }
04566                     catch( std::exception& ex ) {
04567                         errors.push_back( std::string( ex.what() ) + "\n- while parsing: (" + arg.commands() + ")" );
04568                     }
04569                 }
04570                 if( it == itEnd ) {
04571                     if( token.type == Parser::Token::Positional || !m_throwOnUnrecognisedTokens )
04572                         unusedTokens.push_back( token );
04573                     else if( errors.empty() && m_throwOnUnrecognisedTokens )
04574                         errors.push_back( "unrecognised option: " + token.data );
04575                 }
04576             }
04577             if( !errors.empty() ) {
04578                 std::ostringstream oss;
04579                 for( std::vector<std::string>::const_iterator it = errors.begin(), itEnd = errors.end();
04580                         it != itEnd;
04581                         ++it ) {
04582                     if( it != errors.begin() )
04583                         oss << "\n";
04584                     oss << *it;
04585                 }
04586                 throw std::runtime_error( oss.str() );
04587             }
04588             return unusedTokens;
04589         }
04590         std::vector<Parser::Token> populateFixedArgs( std::vector<Parser::Token> const& tokens, ConfigT& config ) const {
04591             std::vector<Parser::Token> unusedTokens;
04592             int position = 1;
04593             for( std::size_t i = 0; i < tokens.size(); ++i ) {
04594                 Parser::Token const& token = tokens[i];
04595                 typename std::map<int, Arg>::const_iterator it = m_positionalArgs.find( position );
04596                 if( it != m_positionalArgs.end() )
04597                     it->second.boundField.set( config, token.data );
04598                 else
04599                     unusedTokens.push_back( token );
04600                 if( token.type == Parser::Token::Positional )
04601                     position++;
04602             }
04603             return unusedTokens;
04604         }
04605         std::vector<Parser::Token> populateFloatingArgs( std::vector<Parser::Token> const& tokens, ConfigT& config ) const {
04606             if( !m_floatingArg.get() )
04607                 return tokens;
04608             std::vector<Parser::Token> unusedTokens;
04609             for( std::size_t i = 0; i < tokens.size(); ++i ) {
04610                 Parser::Token const& token = tokens[i];
04611                 if( token.type == Parser::Token::Positional )
04612                     m_floatingArg->boundField.set( config, token.data );
04613                 else
04614                     unusedTokens.push_back( token );
04615             }
04616             return unusedTokens;
04617         }
04618 
04619         void validate() const
04620         {
04621             if( m_options.empty() && m_positionalArgs.empty() && !m_floatingArg.get() )
04622                 throw std::logic_error( "No options or arguments specified" );
04623 
04624             for( typename std::vector<Arg>::const_iterator  it = m_options.begin(),
04625                                                             itEnd = m_options.end();
04626                     it != itEnd; ++it )
04627                 it->validate();
04628         }
04629 
04630     private:
04631         Detail::BoundArgFunction<ConfigT> m_boundProcessName;
04632         std::vector<Arg> m_options;
04633         std::map<int, Arg> m_positionalArgs;
04634         ArgAutoPtr m_floatingArg;
04635         int m_highestSpecifiedArgPosition;
04636         bool m_throwOnUnrecognisedTokens;
04637     };
04638 
04639 } // end namespace Clara
04640 
04641 STITCH_CLARA_CLOSE_NAMESPACE
04642 #undef STITCH_CLARA_OPEN_NAMESPACE
04643 #undef STITCH_CLARA_CLOSE_NAMESPACE
04644 
04645 #endif // TWOBLUECUBES_CLARA_H_INCLUDED
04646 #undef STITCH_CLARA_OPEN_NAMESPACE
04647 
04648 // Restore Clara's value for console width, if present
04649 #ifdef CATCH_TEMP_CLARA_CONFIG_CONSOLE_WIDTH
04650 #define CLARA_CONFIG_CONSOLE_WIDTH CATCH_TEMP_CLARA_CONFIG_CONSOLE_WIDTH
04651 #undef CATCH_TEMP_CLARA_CONFIG_CONSOLE_WIDTH
04652 #endif
04653 
04654 #include <fstream>
04655 
04656 namespace Catch {
04657 
04658     inline void abortAfterFirst( ConfigData& config ) { config.abortAfter = 1; }
04659     inline void abortAfterX( ConfigData& config, int x ) {
04660         if( x < 1 )
04661             throw std::runtime_error( "Value after -x or --abortAfter must be greater than zero" );
04662         config.abortAfter = x;
04663     }
04664     inline void addTestOrTags( ConfigData& config, std::string const& _testSpec ) { config.testsOrTags.push_back( _testSpec ); }
04665     inline void addReporterName( ConfigData& config, std::string const& _reporterName ) { config.reporterNames.push_back( _reporterName ); }
04666 
04667     inline void addWarning( ConfigData& config, std::string const& _warning ) {
04668         if( _warning == "NoAssertions" )
04669             config.warnings = static_cast<WarnAbout::What>( config.warnings | WarnAbout::NoAssertions );
04670         else
04671             throw std::runtime_error( "Unrecognised warning: '" + _warning + "'" );
04672     }
04673     inline void setOrder( ConfigData& config, std::string const& order ) {
04674         if( startsWith( "declared", order ) )
04675             config.runOrder = RunTests::InDeclarationOrder;
04676         else if( startsWith( "lexical", order ) )
04677             config.runOrder = RunTests::InLexicographicalOrder;
04678         else if( startsWith( "random", order ) )
04679             config.runOrder = RunTests::InRandomOrder;
04680         else
04681             throw std::runtime_error( "Unrecognised ordering: '" + order + "'" );
04682     }
04683     inline void setRngSeed( ConfigData& config, std::string const& seed ) {
04684         if( seed == "time" ) {
04685             config.rngSeed = static_cast<unsigned int>( std::time(0) );
04686         }
04687         else {
04688             std::stringstream ss;
04689             ss << seed;
04690             ss >> config.rngSeed;
04691             if( ss.fail() )
04692                 throw std::runtime_error( "Argment to --rng-seed should be the word 'time' or a number" );
04693         }
04694     }
04695     inline void setVerbosity( ConfigData& config, int level ) {
04696         // !TBD: accept strings?
04697         config.verbosity = static_cast<Verbosity::Level>( level );
04698     }
04699     inline void setShowDurations( ConfigData& config, bool _showDurations ) {
04700         config.showDurations = _showDurations
04701             ? ShowDurations::Always
04702             : ShowDurations::Never;
04703     }
04704     inline void setUseColour( ConfigData& config, std::string const& value ) {
04705         std::string mode = toLower( value );
04706 
04707         if( mode == "yes" )
04708             config.useColour = UseColour::Yes;
04709         else if( mode == "no" )
04710             config.useColour = UseColour::No;
04711         else if( mode == "auto" )
04712             config.useColour = UseColour::Auto;
04713         else
04714             throw std::runtime_error( "colour mode must be one of: auto, yes or no" );
04715     }
04716     inline void forceColour( ConfigData& config ) {
04717         config.useColour = UseColour::Yes;
04718     }
04719     inline void loadTestNamesFromFile( ConfigData& config, std::string const& _filename ) {
04720         std::ifstream f( _filename.c_str() );
04721         if( !f.is_open() )
04722             throw std::domain_error( "Unable to load input file: " + _filename );
04723 
04724         std::string line;
04725         while( std::getline( f, line ) ) {
04726             line = trim(line);
04727             if( !line.empty() && !startsWith( line, "#" ) ) {
04728                 if( !startsWith( line, "\"" ) )
04729                     line = "\"" + line + "\"";
04730                 addTestOrTags( config, line + "," );
04731             }
04732         }
04733     }
04734 
04735     inline Clara::CommandLine<ConfigData> makeCommandLineParser() {
04736 
04737         using namespace Clara;
04738         CommandLine<ConfigData> cli;
04739 
04740         cli.bindProcessName( &ConfigData::processName );
04741 
04742         cli["-?"]["-h"]["--help"]
04743             .describe( "display usage information" )
04744             .bind( &ConfigData::showHelp );
04745 
04746         cli["-l"]["--list-tests"]
04747             .describe( "list all/matching test cases" )
04748             .bind( &ConfigData::listTests );
04749 
04750         cli["-t"]["--list-tags"]
04751             .describe( "list all/matching tags" )
04752             .bind( &ConfigData::listTags );
04753 
04754         cli["-s"]["--success"]
04755             .describe( "include successful tests in output" )
04756             .bind( &ConfigData::showSuccessfulTests );
04757 
04758         cli["-b"]["--break"]
04759             .describe( "break into debugger on failure" )
04760             .bind( &ConfigData::shouldDebugBreak );
04761 
04762         cli["-e"]["--nothrow"]
04763             .describe( "skip exception tests" )
04764             .bind( &ConfigData::noThrow );
04765 
04766         cli["-i"]["--invisibles"]
04767             .describe( "show invisibles (tabs, newlines)" )
04768             .bind( &ConfigData::showInvisibles );
04769 
04770         cli["-o"]["--out"]
04771             .describe( "output filename" )
04772             .bind( &ConfigData::outputFilename, "filename" );
04773 
04774         cli["-r"]["--reporter"]
04775 //            .placeholder( "name[:filename]" )
04776             .describe( "reporter to use (defaults to console)" )
04777             .bind( &addReporterName, "name" );
04778 
04779         cli["-n"]["--name"]
04780             .describe( "suite name" )
04781             .bind( &ConfigData::name, "name" );
04782 
04783         cli["-a"]["--abort"]
04784             .describe( "abort at first failure" )
04785             .bind( &abortAfterFirst );
04786 
04787         cli["-x"]["--abortx"]
04788             .describe( "abort after x failures" )
04789             .bind( &abortAfterX, "no. failures" );
04790 
04791         cli["-w"]["--warn"]
04792             .describe( "enable warnings" )
04793             .bind( &addWarning, "warning name" );
04794 
04795 // - needs updating if reinstated
04796 //        cli.into( &setVerbosity )
04797 //            .describe( "level of verbosity (0=no output)" )
04798 //            .shortOpt( "v")
04799 //            .longOpt( "verbosity" )
04800 //            .placeholder( "level" );
04801 
04802         cli[_]
04803             .describe( "which test or tests to use" )
04804             .bind( &addTestOrTags, "test name, pattern or tags" );
04805 
04806         cli["-d"]["--durations"]
04807             .describe( "show test durations" )
04808             .bind( &setShowDurations, "yes|no" );
04809 
04810         cli["-f"]["--input-file"]
04811             .describe( "load test names to run from a file" )
04812             .bind( &loadTestNamesFromFile, "filename" );
04813 
04814         cli["-#"]["--filenames-as-tags"]
04815             .describe( "adds a tag for the filename" )
04816             .bind( &ConfigData::filenamesAsTags );
04817 
04818         // Less common commands which don't have a short form
04819         cli["--list-test-names-only"]
04820             .describe( "list all/matching test cases names only" )
04821             .bind( &ConfigData::listTestNamesOnly );
04822 
04823         cli["--list-reporters"]
04824             .describe( "list all reporters" )
04825             .bind( &ConfigData::listReporters );
04826 
04827         cli["--order"]
04828             .describe( "test case order (defaults to decl)" )
04829             .bind( &setOrder, "decl|lex|rand" );
04830 
04831         cli["--rng-seed"]
04832             .describe( "set a specific seed for random numbers" )
04833             .bind( &setRngSeed, "'time'|number" );
04834 
04835         cli["--force-colour"]
04836             .describe( "force colourised output (deprecated)" )
04837             .bind( &forceColour );
04838 
04839         cli["--use-colour"]
04840             .describe( "should output be colourised" )
04841             .bind( &setUseColour, "yes|no" );
04842 
04843         return cli;
04844     }
04845 
04846 } // end namespace Catch
04847 
04848 // #included from: internal/catch_list.hpp
04849 #define TWOBLUECUBES_CATCH_LIST_HPP_INCLUDED
04850 
04851 // #included from: catch_text.h
04852 #define TWOBLUECUBES_CATCH_TEXT_H_INCLUDED
04853 
04854 #define TBC_TEXT_FORMAT_CONSOLE_WIDTH CATCH_CONFIG_CONSOLE_WIDTH
04855 
04856 #define CLICHE_TBC_TEXT_FORMAT_OUTER_NAMESPACE Catch
04857 // #included from: ../external/tbc_text_format.h
04858 // Only use header guard if we are not using an outer namespace
04859 #ifndef CLICHE_TBC_TEXT_FORMAT_OUTER_NAMESPACE
04860 # ifdef TWOBLUECUBES_TEXT_FORMAT_H_INCLUDED
04861 #  ifndef TWOBLUECUBES_TEXT_FORMAT_H_ALREADY_INCLUDED
04862 #   define TWOBLUECUBES_TEXT_FORMAT_H_ALREADY_INCLUDED
04863 #  endif
04864 # else
04865 #  define TWOBLUECUBES_TEXT_FORMAT_H_INCLUDED
04866 # endif
04867 #endif
04868 #ifndef TWOBLUECUBES_TEXT_FORMAT_H_ALREADY_INCLUDED
04869 #include <string>
04870 #include <vector>
04871 #include <sstream>
04872 
04873 // Use optional outer namespace
04874 #ifdef CLICHE_TBC_TEXT_FORMAT_OUTER_NAMESPACE
04875 namespace CLICHE_TBC_TEXT_FORMAT_OUTER_NAMESPACE {
04876 #endif
04877 
04878 namespace Tbc {
04879 
04880 #ifdef TBC_TEXT_FORMAT_CONSOLE_WIDTH
04881     const unsigned int consoleWidth = TBC_TEXT_FORMAT_CONSOLE_WIDTH;
04882 #else
04883     const unsigned int consoleWidth = 80;
04884 #endif
04885 
04886     struct TextAttributes {
04887         TextAttributes()
04888         :   initialIndent( std::string::npos ),
04889             indent( 0 ),
04890             width( consoleWidth-1 ),
04891             tabChar( '\t' )
04892         {}
04893 
04894         TextAttributes& setInitialIndent( std::size_t _value )  { initialIndent = _value; return *this; }
04895         TextAttributes& setIndent( std::size_t _value )         { indent = _value; return *this; }
04896         TextAttributes& setWidth( std::size_t _value )          { width = _value; return *this; }
04897         TextAttributes& setTabChar( char _value )               { tabChar = _value; return *this; }
04898 
04899         std::size_t initialIndent;  // indent of first line, or npos
04900         std::size_t indent;         // indent of subsequent lines, or all if initialIndent is npos
04901         std::size_t width;          // maximum width of text, including indent. Longer text will wrap
04902         char tabChar;               // If this char is seen the indent is changed to current pos
04903     };
04904 
04905     class Text {
04906     public:
04907         Text( std::string const& _str, TextAttributes const& _attr = TextAttributes() )
04908         : attr( _attr )
04909         {
04910             std::string wrappableChars = " [({.,/|\\-";
04911             std::size_t indent = _attr.initialIndent != std::string::npos
04912                 ? _attr.initialIndent
04913                 : _attr.indent;
04914             std::string remainder = _str;
04915 
04916             while( !remainder.empty() ) {
04917                 if( lines.size() >= 1000 ) {
04918                     lines.push_back( "... message truncated due to excessive size" );
04919                     return;
04920                 }
04921                 std::size_t tabPos = std::string::npos;
04922                 std::size_t width = (std::min)( remainder.size(), _attr.width - indent );
04923                 std::size_t pos = remainder.find_first_of( '\n' );
04924                 if( pos <= width ) {
04925                     width = pos;
04926                 }
04927                 pos = remainder.find_last_of( _attr.tabChar, width );
04928                 if( pos != std::string::npos ) {
04929                     tabPos = pos;
04930                     if( remainder[width] == '\n' )
04931                         width--;
04932                     remainder = remainder.substr( 0, tabPos ) + remainder.substr( tabPos+1 );
04933                 }
04934 
04935                 if( width == remainder.size() ) {
04936                     spliceLine( indent, remainder, width );
04937                 }
04938                 else if( remainder[width] == '\n' ) {
04939                     spliceLine( indent, remainder, width );
04940                     if( width <= 1 || remainder.size() != 1 )
04941                         remainder = remainder.substr( 1 );
04942                     indent = _attr.indent;
04943                 }
04944                 else {
04945                     pos = remainder.find_last_of( wrappableChars, width );
04946                     if( pos != std::string::npos && pos > 0 ) {
04947                         spliceLine( indent, remainder, pos );
04948                         if( remainder[0] == ' ' )
04949                             remainder = remainder.substr( 1 );
04950                     }
04951                     else {
04952                         spliceLine( indent, remainder, width-1 );
04953                         lines.back() += "-";
04954                     }
04955                     if( lines.size() == 1 )
04956                         indent = _attr.indent;
04957                     if( tabPos != std::string::npos )
04958                         indent += tabPos;
04959                 }
04960             }
04961         }
04962 
04963         void spliceLine( std::size_t _indent, std::string& _remainder, std::size_t _pos ) {
04964             lines.push_back( std::string( _indent, ' ' ) + _remainder.substr( 0, _pos ) );
04965             _remainder = _remainder.substr( _pos );
04966         }
04967 
04968         typedef std::vector<std::string>::const_iterator const_iterator;
04969 
04970         const_iterator begin() const { return lines.begin(); }
04971         const_iterator end() const { return lines.end(); }
04972         std::string const& last() const { return lines.back(); }
04973         std::size_t size() const { return lines.size(); }
04974         std::string const& operator[]( std::size_t _index ) const { return lines[_index]; }
04975         std::string toString() const {
04976             std::ostringstream oss;
04977             oss << *this;
04978             return oss.str();
04979         }
04980 
04981         inline friend std::ostream& operator << ( std::ostream& _stream, Text const& _text ) {
04982             for( Text::const_iterator it = _text.begin(), itEnd = _text.end();
04983                 it != itEnd; ++it ) {
04984                 if( it != _text.begin() )
04985                     _stream << "\n";
04986                 _stream << *it;
04987             }
04988             return _stream;
04989         }
04990 
04991     private:
04992         std::string str;
04993         TextAttributes attr;
04994         std::vector<std::string> lines;
04995     };
04996 
04997 } // end namespace Tbc
04998 
04999 #ifdef CLICHE_TBC_TEXT_FORMAT_OUTER_NAMESPACE
05000 } // end outer namespace
05001 #endif
05002 
05003 #endif // TWOBLUECUBES_TEXT_FORMAT_H_ALREADY_INCLUDED
05004 #undef CLICHE_TBC_TEXT_FORMAT_OUTER_NAMESPACE
05005 
05006 namespace Catch {
05007     using Tbc::Text;
05008     using Tbc::TextAttributes;
05009 }
05010 
05011 // #included from: catch_console_colour.hpp
05012 #define TWOBLUECUBES_CATCH_CONSOLE_COLOUR_HPP_INCLUDED
05013 
05014 namespace Catch {
05015 
05016     struct Colour {
05017         enum Code {
05018             None = 0,
05019 
05020             White,
05021             Red,
05022             Green,
05023             Blue,
05024             Cyan,
05025             Yellow,
05026             Grey,
05027 
05028             Bright = 0x10,
05029 
05030             BrightRed = Bright | Red,
05031             BrightGreen = Bright | Green,
05032             LightGrey = Bright | Grey,
05033             BrightWhite = Bright | White,
05034 
05035             // By intention
05036             FileName = LightGrey,
05037             Warning = Yellow,
05038             ResultError = BrightRed,
05039             ResultSuccess = BrightGreen,
05040             ResultExpectedFailure = Warning,
05041 
05042             Error = BrightRed,
05043             Success = Green,
05044 
05045             OriginalExpression = Cyan,
05046             ReconstructedExpression = Yellow,
05047 
05048             SecondaryText = LightGrey,
05049             Headers = White
05050         };
05051 
05052         // Use constructed object for RAII guard
05053         Colour( Code _colourCode );
05054         Colour( Colour const& other );
05055         ~Colour();
05056 
05057         // Use static method for one-shot changes
05058         static void use( Code _colourCode );
05059 
05060     private:
05061         bool m_moved;
05062     };
05063 
05064     inline std::ostream& operator << ( std::ostream& os, Colour const& ) { return os; }
05065 
05066 } // end namespace Catch
05067 
05068 // #included from: catch_interfaces_reporter.h
05069 #define TWOBLUECUBES_CATCH_INTERFACES_REPORTER_H_INCLUDED
05070 
05071 #include <string>
05072 #include <ostream>
05073 #include <map>
05074 #include <assert.h>
05075 
05076 namespace Catch
05077 {
05078     struct ReporterConfig {
05079         explicit ReporterConfig( Ptr<IConfig const> const& _fullConfig )
05080         :   m_stream( &_fullConfig->stream() ), m_fullConfig( _fullConfig ) {}
05081 
05082         ReporterConfig( Ptr<IConfig const> const& _fullConfig, std::ostream& _stream )
05083         :   m_stream( &_stream ), m_fullConfig( _fullConfig ) {}
05084 
05085         std::ostream& stream() const    { return *m_stream; }
05086         Ptr<IConfig const> fullConfig() const { return m_fullConfig; }
05087 
05088     private:
05089         std::ostream* m_stream;
05090         Ptr<IConfig const> m_fullConfig;
05091     };
05092 
05093     struct ReporterPreferences {
05094         ReporterPreferences()
05095         : shouldRedirectStdOut( false )
05096         {}
05097 
05098         bool shouldRedirectStdOut;
05099     };
05100 
05101     template<typename T>
05102     struct LazyStat : Option<T> {
05103         LazyStat() : used( false ) {}
05104         LazyStat& operator=( T const& _value ) {
05105             Option<T>::operator=( _value );
05106             used = false;
05107             return *this;
05108         }
05109         void reset() {
05110             Option<T>::reset();
05111             used = false;
05112         }
05113         bool used;
05114     };
05115 
05116     struct TestRunInfo {
05117         TestRunInfo( std::string const& _name ) : name( _name ) {}
05118         std::string name;
05119     };
05120     struct GroupInfo {
05121         GroupInfo(  std::string const& _name,
05122                     std::size_t _groupIndex,
05123                     std::size_t _groupsCount )
05124         :   name( _name ),
05125             groupIndex( _groupIndex ),
05126             groupsCounts( _groupsCount )
05127         {}
05128 
05129         std::string name;
05130         std::size_t groupIndex;
05131         std::size_t groupsCounts;
05132     };
05133 
05134     struct AssertionStats {
05135         AssertionStats( AssertionResult const& _assertionResult,
05136                         std::vector<MessageInfo> const& _infoMessages,
05137                         Totals const& _totals )
05138         :   assertionResult( _assertionResult ),
05139             infoMessages( _infoMessages ),
05140             totals( _totals )
05141         {
05142             if( assertionResult.hasMessage() ) {
05143                 // Copy message into messages list.
05144                 // !TBD This should have been done earlier, somewhere
05145                 MessageBuilder builder( assertionResult.getTestMacroName(), assertionResult.getSourceInfo(), assertionResult.getResultType() );
05146                 builder << assertionResult.getMessage();
05147                 builder.m_info.message = builder.m_stream.str();
05148 
05149                 infoMessages.push_back( builder.m_info );
05150             }
05151         }
05152         virtual ~AssertionStats();
05153 
05154 #  ifdef CATCH_CONFIG_CPP11_GENERATED_METHODS
05155         AssertionStats( AssertionStats const& )              = default;
05156         AssertionStats( AssertionStats && )                  = default;
05157         AssertionStats& operator = ( AssertionStats const& ) = default;
05158         AssertionStats& operator = ( AssertionStats && )     = default;
05159 #  endif
05160 
05161         AssertionResult assertionResult;
05162         std::vector<MessageInfo> infoMessages;
05163         Totals totals;
05164     };
05165 
05166     struct SectionStats {
05167         SectionStats(   SectionInfo const& _sectionInfo,
05168                         Counts const& _assertions,
05169                         double _durationInSeconds,
05170                         bool _missingAssertions )
05171         :   sectionInfo( _sectionInfo ),
05172             assertions( _assertions ),
05173             durationInSeconds( _durationInSeconds ),
05174             missingAssertions( _missingAssertions )
05175         {}
05176         virtual ~SectionStats();
05177 #  ifdef CATCH_CONFIG_CPP11_GENERATED_METHODS
05178         SectionStats( SectionStats const& )              = default;
05179         SectionStats( SectionStats && )                  = default;
05180         SectionStats& operator = ( SectionStats const& ) = default;
05181         SectionStats& operator = ( SectionStats && )     = default;
05182 #  endif
05183 
05184         SectionInfo sectionInfo;
05185         Counts assertions;
05186         double durationInSeconds;
05187         bool missingAssertions;
05188     };
05189 
05190     struct TestCaseStats {
05191         TestCaseStats(  TestCaseInfo const& _testInfo,
05192                         Totals const& _totals,
05193                         std::string const& _stdOut,
05194                         std::string const& _stdErr,
05195                         bool _aborting )
05196         : testInfo( _testInfo ),
05197             totals( _totals ),
05198             stdOut( _stdOut ),
05199             stdErr( _stdErr ),
05200             aborting( _aborting )
05201         {}
05202         virtual ~TestCaseStats();
05203 
05204 #  ifdef CATCH_CONFIG_CPP11_GENERATED_METHODS
05205         TestCaseStats( TestCaseStats const& )              = default;
05206         TestCaseStats( TestCaseStats && )                  = default;
05207         TestCaseStats& operator = ( TestCaseStats const& ) = default;
05208         TestCaseStats& operator = ( TestCaseStats && )     = default;
05209 #  endif
05210 
05211         TestCaseInfo testInfo;
05212         Totals totals;
05213         std::string stdOut;
05214         std::string stdErr;
05215         bool aborting;
05216     };
05217 
05218     struct TestGroupStats {
05219         TestGroupStats( GroupInfo const& _groupInfo,
05220                         Totals const& _totals,
05221                         bool _aborting )
05222         :   groupInfo( _groupInfo ),
05223             totals( _totals ),
05224             aborting( _aborting )
05225         {}
05226         TestGroupStats( GroupInfo const& _groupInfo )
05227         :   groupInfo( _groupInfo ),
05228             aborting( false )
05229         {}
05230         virtual ~TestGroupStats();
05231 
05232 #  ifdef CATCH_CONFIG_CPP11_GENERATED_METHODS
05233         TestGroupStats( TestGroupStats const& )              = default;
05234         TestGroupStats( TestGroupStats && )                  = default;
05235         TestGroupStats& operator = ( TestGroupStats const& ) = default;
05236         TestGroupStats& operator = ( TestGroupStats && )     = default;
05237 #  endif
05238 
05239         GroupInfo groupInfo;
05240         Totals totals;
05241         bool aborting;
05242     };
05243 
05244     struct TestRunStats {
05245         TestRunStats(   TestRunInfo const& _runInfo,
05246                         Totals const& _totals,
05247                         bool _aborting )
05248         :   runInfo( _runInfo ),
05249             totals( _totals ),
05250             aborting( _aborting )
05251         {}
05252         virtual ~TestRunStats();
05253 
05254 #  ifndef CATCH_CONFIG_CPP11_GENERATED_METHODS
05255         TestRunStats( TestRunStats const& _other )
05256         :   runInfo( _other.runInfo ),
05257             totals( _other.totals ),
05258             aborting( _other.aborting )
05259         {}
05260 #  else
05261         TestRunStats( TestRunStats const& )              = default;
05262         TestRunStats( TestRunStats && )                  = default;
05263         TestRunStats& operator = ( TestRunStats const& ) = default;
05264         TestRunStats& operator = ( TestRunStats && )     = default;
05265 #  endif
05266 
05267         TestRunInfo runInfo;
05268         Totals totals;
05269         bool aborting;
05270     };
05271 
05272     class MultipleReporters;
05273 
05274     struct IStreamingReporter : IShared {
05275         virtual ~IStreamingReporter();
05276 
05277         // Implementing class must also provide the following static method:
05278         // static std::string getDescription();
05279 
05280         virtual ReporterPreferences getPreferences() const = 0;
05281 
05282         virtual void noMatchingTestCases( std::string const& spec ) = 0;
05283 
05284         virtual void testRunStarting( TestRunInfo const& testRunInfo ) = 0;
05285         virtual void testGroupStarting( GroupInfo const& groupInfo ) = 0;
05286 
05287         virtual void testCaseStarting( TestCaseInfo const& testInfo ) = 0;
05288         virtual void sectionStarting( SectionInfo const& sectionInfo ) = 0;
05289 
05290         virtual void assertionStarting( AssertionInfo const& assertionInfo ) = 0;
05291 
05292         // The return value indicates if the messages buffer should be cleared:
05293         virtual bool assertionEnded( AssertionStats const& assertionStats ) = 0;
05294 
05295         virtual void sectionEnded( SectionStats const& sectionStats ) = 0;
05296         virtual void testCaseEnded( TestCaseStats const& testCaseStats ) = 0;
05297         virtual void testGroupEnded( TestGroupStats const& testGroupStats ) = 0;
05298         virtual void testRunEnded( TestRunStats const& testRunStats ) = 0;
05299 
05300         virtual void skipTest( TestCaseInfo const& testInfo ) = 0;
05301 
05302         virtual MultipleReporters* tryAsMulti() { return CATCH_NULL; }
05303     };
05304 
05305     struct IReporterFactory : IShared {
05306         virtual ~IReporterFactory();
05307         virtual IStreamingReporter* create( ReporterConfig const& config ) const = 0;
05308         virtual std::string getDescription() const = 0;
05309     };
05310 
05311     struct IReporterRegistry {
05312         typedef std::map<std::string, Ptr<IReporterFactory> > FactoryMap;
05313         typedef std::vector<Ptr<IReporterFactory> > Listeners;
05314 
05315         virtual ~IReporterRegistry();
05316         virtual IStreamingReporter* create( std::string const& name, Ptr<IConfig const> const& config ) const = 0;
05317         virtual FactoryMap const& getFactories() const = 0;
05318         virtual Listeners const& getListeners() const = 0;
05319     };
05320 
05321     Ptr<IStreamingReporter> addReporter( Ptr<IStreamingReporter> const& existingReporter, Ptr<IStreamingReporter> const& additionalReporter );
05322 
05323 }
05324 
05325 #include <limits>
05326 #include <algorithm>
05327 
05328 namespace Catch {
05329 
05330     inline std::size_t listTests( Config const& config ) {
05331 
05332         TestSpec testSpec = config.testSpec();
05333         if( config.testSpec().hasFilters() )
05334             Catch::cout() << "Matching test cases:\n";
05335         else {
05336             Catch::cout() << "All available test cases:\n";
05337             testSpec = TestSpecParser( ITagAliasRegistry::get() ).parse( "*" ).testSpec();
05338         }
05339 
05340         std::size_t matchedTests = 0;
05341         TextAttributes nameAttr, tagsAttr;
05342         nameAttr.setInitialIndent( 2 ).setIndent( 4 );
05343         tagsAttr.setIndent( 6 );
05344 
05345         std::vector<TestCase> matchedTestCases = filterTests( getAllTestCasesSorted( config ), testSpec, config );
05346         for( std::vector<TestCase>::const_iterator it = matchedTestCases.begin(), itEnd = matchedTestCases.end();
05347                 it != itEnd;
05348                 ++it ) {
05349             matchedTests++;
05350             TestCaseInfo const& testCaseInfo = it->getTestCaseInfo();
05351             Colour::Code colour = testCaseInfo.isHidden()
05352                 ? Colour::SecondaryText
05353                 : Colour::None;
05354             Colour colourGuard( colour );
05355 
05356             Catch::cout() << Text( testCaseInfo.name, nameAttr ) << std::endl;
05357             if( !testCaseInfo.tags.empty() )
05358                 Catch::cout() << Text( testCaseInfo.tagsAsString, tagsAttr ) << std::endl;
05359         }
05360 
05361         if( !config.testSpec().hasFilters() )
05362             Catch::cout() << pluralise( matchedTests, "test case" ) << "\n" << std::endl;
05363         else
05364             Catch::cout() << pluralise( matchedTests, "matching test case" ) << "\n" << std::endl;
05365         return matchedTests;
05366     }
05367 
05368     inline std::size_t listTestsNamesOnly( Config const& config ) {
05369         TestSpec testSpec = config.testSpec();
05370         if( !config.testSpec().hasFilters() )
05371             testSpec = TestSpecParser( ITagAliasRegistry::get() ).parse( "*" ).testSpec();
05372         std::size_t matchedTests = 0;
05373         std::vector<TestCase> matchedTestCases = filterTests( getAllTestCasesSorted( config ), testSpec, config );
05374         for( std::vector<TestCase>::const_iterator it = matchedTestCases.begin(), itEnd = matchedTestCases.end();
05375                 it != itEnd;
05376                 ++it ) {
05377             matchedTests++;
05378             TestCaseInfo const& testCaseInfo = it->getTestCaseInfo();
05379             if( startsWith( testCaseInfo.name, "#" ) )
05380                Catch::cout() << "\"" << testCaseInfo.name << "\"" << std::endl;
05381             else
05382                Catch::cout() << testCaseInfo.name << std::endl;
05383         }
05384         return matchedTests;
05385     }
05386 
05387     struct TagInfo {
05388         TagInfo() : count ( 0 ) {}
05389         void add( std::string const& spelling ) {
05390             ++count;
05391             spellings.insert( spelling );
05392         }
05393         std::string all() const {
05394             std::string out;
05395             for( std::set<std::string>::const_iterator it = spellings.begin(), itEnd = spellings.end();
05396                         it != itEnd;
05397                         ++it )
05398                 out += "[" + *it + "]";
05399             return out;
05400         }
05401         std::set<std::string> spellings;
05402         std::size_t count;
05403     };
05404 
05405     inline std::size_t listTags( Config const& config ) {
05406         TestSpec testSpec = config.testSpec();
05407         if( config.testSpec().hasFilters() )
05408             Catch::cout() << "Tags for matching test cases:\n";
05409         else {
05410             Catch::cout() << "All available tags:\n";
05411             testSpec = TestSpecParser( ITagAliasRegistry::get() ).parse( "*" ).testSpec();
05412         }
05413 
05414         std::map<std::string, TagInfo> tagCounts;
05415 
05416         std::vector<TestCase> matchedTestCases = filterTests( getAllTestCasesSorted( config ), testSpec, config );
05417         for( std::vector<TestCase>::const_iterator it = matchedTestCases.begin(), itEnd = matchedTestCases.end();
05418                 it != itEnd;
05419                 ++it ) {
05420             for( std::set<std::string>::const_iterator  tagIt = it->getTestCaseInfo().tags.begin(),
05421                                                         tagItEnd = it->getTestCaseInfo().tags.end();
05422                     tagIt != tagItEnd;
05423                     ++tagIt ) {
05424                 std::string tagName = *tagIt;
05425                 std::string lcaseTagName = toLower( tagName );
05426                 std::map<std::string, TagInfo>::iterator countIt = tagCounts.find( lcaseTagName );
05427                 if( countIt == tagCounts.end() )
05428                     countIt = tagCounts.insert( std::make_pair( lcaseTagName, TagInfo() ) ).first;
05429                 countIt->second.add( tagName );
05430             }
05431         }
05432 
05433         for( std::map<std::string, TagInfo>::const_iterator countIt = tagCounts.begin(),
05434                                                             countItEnd = tagCounts.end();
05435                 countIt != countItEnd;
05436                 ++countIt ) {
05437             std::ostringstream oss;
05438             oss << "  " << std::setw(2) << countIt->second.count << "  ";
05439             Text wrapper( countIt->second.all(), TextAttributes()
05440                                                     .setInitialIndent( 0 )
05441                                                     .setIndent( oss.str().size() )
05442                                                     .setWidth( CATCH_CONFIG_CONSOLE_WIDTH-10 ) );
05443             Catch::cout() << oss.str() << wrapper << "\n";
05444         }
05445         Catch::cout() << pluralise( tagCounts.size(), "tag" ) << "\n" << std::endl;
05446         return tagCounts.size();
05447     }
05448 
05449     inline std::size_t listReporters( Config const& /*config*/ ) {
05450         Catch::cout() << "Available reporters:\n";
05451         IReporterRegistry::FactoryMap const& factories = getRegistryHub().getReporterRegistry().getFactories();
05452         IReporterRegistry::FactoryMap::const_iterator itBegin = factories.begin(), itEnd = factories.end(), it;
05453         std::size_t maxNameLen = 0;
05454         for(it = itBegin; it != itEnd; ++it )
05455             maxNameLen = (std::max)( maxNameLen, it->first.size() );
05456 
05457         for(it = itBegin; it != itEnd; ++it ) {
05458             Text wrapper( it->second->getDescription(), TextAttributes()
05459                                                         .setInitialIndent( 0 )
05460                                                         .setIndent( 7+maxNameLen )
05461                                                         .setWidth( CATCH_CONFIG_CONSOLE_WIDTH - maxNameLen-8 ) );
05462             Catch::cout() << "  "
05463                     << it->first
05464                     << ":"
05465                     << std::string( maxNameLen - it->first.size() + 2, ' ' )
05466                     << wrapper << "\n";
05467         }
05468         Catch::cout() << std::endl;
05469         return factories.size();
05470     }
05471 
05472     inline Option<std::size_t> list( Config const& config ) {
05473         Option<std::size_t> listedCount;
05474         if( config.listTests() )
05475             listedCount = listedCount.valueOr(0) + listTests( config );
05476         if( config.listTestNamesOnly() )
05477             listedCount = listedCount.valueOr(0) + listTestsNamesOnly( config );
05478         if( config.listTags() )
05479             listedCount = listedCount.valueOr(0) + listTags( config );
05480         if( config.listReporters() )
05481             listedCount = listedCount.valueOr(0) + listReporters( config );
05482         return listedCount;
05483     }
05484 
05485 } // end namespace Catch
05486 
05487 // #included from: internal/catch_run_context.hpp
05488 #define TWOBLUECUBES_CATCH_RUNNER_IMPL_HPP_INCLUDED
05489 
05490 // #included from: catch_test_case_tracker.hpp
05491 #define TWOBLUECUBES_CATCH_TEST_CASE_TRACKER_HPP_INCLUDED
05492 
05493 #include <map>
05494 #include <string>
05495 #include <assert.h>
05496 #include <vector>
05497 
05498 namespace Catch {
05499 namespace TestCaseTracking {
05500 
05501     struct ITracker : SharedImpl<> {
05502         virtual ~ITracker();
05503 
05504         // static queries
05505         virtual std::string name() const = 0;
05506 
05507         // dynamic queries
05508         virtual bool isComplete() const = 0; // Successfully completed or failed
05509         virtual bool isSuccessfullyCompleted() const = 0;
05510         virtual bool isOpen() const = 0; // Started but not complete
05511         virtual bool hasChildren() const = 0;
05512 
05513         virtual ITracker& parent() = 0;
05514 
05515         // actions
05516         virtual void close() = 0; // Successfully complete
05517         virtual void fail() = 0;
05518         virtual void markAsNeedingAnotherRun() = 0;
05519 
05520         virtual void addChild( Ptr<ITracker> const& child ) = 0;
05521         virtual ITracker* findChild( std::string const& name ) = 0;
05522         virtual void openChild() = 0;
05523 
05524         // Debug/ checking
05525         virtual bool isSectionTracker() const = 0;
05526         virtual bool isIndexTracker() const = 0;
05527     };
05528 
05529     class TrackerContext {
05530 
05531         enum RunState {
05532             NotStarted,
05533             Executing,
05534             CompletedCycle
05535         };
05536 
05537         Ptr<ITracker> m_rootTracker;
05538         ITracker* m_currentTracker;
05539         RunState m_runState;
05540 
05541     public:
05542 
05543         static TrackerContext& instance() {
05544             static TrackerContext s_instance;
05545             return s_instance;
05546         }
05547 
05548         TrackerContext()
05549         :   m_currentTracker( CATCH_NULL ),
05550             m_runState( NotStarted )
05551         {}
05552 
05553         ITracker& startRun();
05554 
05555         void endRun() {
05556             m_rootTracker.reset();
05557             m_currentTracker = CATCH_NULL;
05558             m_runState = NotStarted;
05559         }
05560 
05561         void startCycle() {
05562             m_currentTracker = m_rootTracker.get();
05563             m_runState = Executing;
05564         }
05565         void completeCycle() {
05566             m_runState = CompletedCycle;
05567         }
05568 
05569         bool completedCycle() const {
05570             return m_runState == CompletedCycle;
05571         }
05572         ITracker& currentTracker() {
05573             return *m_currentTracker;
05574         }
05575         void setCurrentTracker( ITracker* tracker ) {
05576             m_currentTracker = tracker;
05577         }
05578     };
05579 
05580     class TrackerBase : public ITracker {
05581     protected:
05582         enum CycleState {
05583             NotStarted,
05584             Executing,
05585             ExecutingChildren,
05586             NeedsAnotherRun,
05587             CompletedSuccessfully,
05588             Failed
05589         };
05590         class TrackerHasName {
05591             std::string m_name;
05592         public:
05593             TrackerHasName( std::string const& name ) : m_name( name ) {}
05594             bool operator ()( Ptr<ITracker> const& tracker ) {
05595                 return tracker->name() == m_name;
05596             }
05597         };
05598         typedef std::vector<Ptr<ITracker> > Children;
05599         std::string m_name;
05600         TrackerContext& m_ctx;
05601         ITracker* m_parent;
05602         Children m_children;
05603         CycleState m_runState;
05604     public:
05605         TrackerBase( std::string const& name, TrackerContext& ctx, ITracker* parent )
05606         :   m_name( name ),
05607             m_ctx( ctx ),
05608             m_parent( parent ),
05609             m_runState( NotStarted )
05610         {}
05611         virtual ~TrackerBase();
05612 
05613         virtual std::string name() const CATCH_OVERRIDE {
05614             return m_name;
05615         }
05616         virtual bool isComplete() const CATCH_OVERRIDE {
05617             return m_runState == CompletedSuccessfully || m_runState == Failed;
05618         }
05619         virtual bool isSuccessfullyCompleted() const CATCH_OVERRIDE {
05620             return m_runState == CompletedSuccessfully;
05621         }
05622         virtual bool isOpen() const CATCH_OVERRIDE {
05623             return m_runState != NotStarted && !isComplete();
05624         }
05625         virtual bool hasChildren() const CATCH_OVERRIDE {
05626             return !m_children.empty();
05627         }
05628 
05629         virtual void addChild( Ptr<ITracker> const& child ) CATCH_OVERRIDE {
05630             m_children.push_back( child );
05631         }
05632 
05633         virtual ITracker* findChild( std::string const& name ) CATCH_OVERRIDE {
05634             Children::const_iterator it = std::find_if( m_children.begin(), m_children.end(), TrackerHasName( name ) );
05635             return( it != m_children.end() )
05636                 ? it->get()
05637                 : CATCH_NULL;
05638         }
05639         virtual ITracker& parent() CATCH_OVERRIDE {
05640             assert( m_parent ); // Should always be non-null except for root
05641             return *m_parent;
05642         }
05643 
05644         virtual void openChild() CATCH_OVERRIDE {
05645             if( m_runState != ExecutingChildren ) {
05646                 m_runState = ExecutingChildren;
05647                 if( m_parent )
05648                     m_parent->openChild();
05649             }
05650         }
05651 
05652         virtual bool isSectionTracker() const CATCH_OVERRIDE { return false; }
05653         virtual bool isIndexTracker() const CATCH_OVERRIDE { return false; }
05654 
05655         void open() {
05656             m_runState = Executing;
05657             moveToThis();
05658             if( m_parent )
05659                 m_parent->openChild();
05660         }
05661 
05662         virtual void close() CATCH_OVERRIDE {
05663 
05664             // Close any still open children (e.g. generators)
05665             while( &m_ctx.currentTracker() != this )
05666                 m_ctx.currentTracker().close();
05667 
05668             switch( m_runState ) {
05669                 case NotStarted:
05670                 case CompletedSuccessfully:
05671                 case Failed:
05672                     throw std::logic_error( "Illogical state" );
05673 
05674                 case NeedsAnotherRun:
05675                     break;;
05676 
05677                 case Executing:
05678                     m_runState = CompletedSuccessfully;
05679                     break;
05680                 case ExecutingChildren:
05681                     if( m_children.empty() || m_children.back()->isComplete() )
05682                         m_runState = CompletedSuccessfully;
05683                     break;
05684 
05685                 default:
05686                     throw std::logic_error( "Unexpected state" );
05687             }
05688             moveToParent();
05689             m_ctx.completeCycle();
05690         }
05691         virtual void fail() CATCH_OVERRIDE {
05692             m_runState = Failed;
05693             if( m_parent )
05694                 m_parent->markAsNeedingAnotherRun();
05695             moveToParent();
05696             m_ctx.completeCycle();
05697         }
05698         virtual void markAsNeedingAnotherRun() CATCH_OVERRIDE {
05699             m_runState = NeedsAnotherRun;
05700         }
05701     private:
05702         void moveToParent() {
05703             assert( m_parent );
05704             m_ctx.setCurrentTracker( m_parent );
05705         }
05706         void moveToThis() {
05707             m_ctx.setCurrentTracker( this );
05708         }
05709     };
05710 
05711     class SectionTracker : public TrackerBase {
05712     public:
05713         SectionTracker( std::string const& name, TrackerContext& ctx, ITracker* parent )
05714         :   TrackerBase( name, ctx, parent )
05715         {}
05716         virtual ~SectionTracker();
05717 
05718         virtual bool isSectionTracker() const CATCH_OVERRIDE { return true; }
05719 
05720         static SectionTracker& acquire( TrackerContext& ctx, std::string const& name ) {
05721             SectionTracker* section = CATCH_NULL;
05722 
05723             ITracker& currentTracker = ctx.currentTracker();
05724             if( ITracker* childTracker = currentTracker.findChild( name ) ) {
05725                 assert( childTracker );
05726                 assert( childTracker->isSectionTracker() );
05727                 section = static_cast<SectionTracker*>( childTracker );
05728             }
05729             else {
05730                 section = new SectionTracker( name, ctx, &currentTracker );
05731                 currentTracker.addChild( section );
05732             }
05733             if( !ctx.completedCycle() && !section->isComplete() ) {
05734 
05735                 section->open();
05736             }
05737             return *section;
05738         }
05739     };
05740 
05741     class IndexTracker : public TrackerBase {
05742         int m_size;
05743         int m_index;
05744     public:
05745         IndexTracker( std::string const& name, TrackerContext& ctx, ITracker* parent, int size )
05746         :   TrackerBase( name, ctx, parent ),
05747             m_size( size ),
05748             m_index( -1 )
05749         {}
05750         virtual ~IndexTracker();
05751 
05752         virtual bool isIndexTracker() const CATCH_OVERRIDE { return true; }
05753 
05754         static IndexTracker& acquire( TrackerContext& ctx, std::string const& name, int size ) {
05755             IndexTracker* tracker = CATCH_NULL;
05756 
05757             ITracker& currentTracker = ctx.currentTracker();
05758             if( ITracker* childTracker = currentTracker.findChild( name ) ) {
05759                 assert( childTracker );
05760                 assert( childTracker->isIndexTracker() );
05761                 tracker = static_cast<IndexTracker*>( childTracker );
05762             }
05763             else {
05764                 tracker = new IndexTracker( name, ctx, &currentTracker, size );
05765                 currentTracker.addChild( tracker );
05766             }
05767 
05768             if( !ctx.completedCycle() && !tracker->isComplete() ) {
05769                 if( tracker->m_runState != ExecutingChildren && tracker->m_runState != NeedsAnotherRun )
05770                     tracker->moveNext();
05771                 tracker->open();
05772             }
05773 
05774             return *tracker;
05775         }
05776 
05777         int index() const { return m_index; }
05778 
05779         void moveNext() {
05780             m_index++;
05781             m_children.clear();
05782         }
05783 
05784         virtual void close() CATCH_OVERRIDE {
05785             TrackerBase::close();
05786             if( m_runState == CompletedSuccessfully && m_index < m_size-1 )
05787                 m_runState = Executing;
05788         }
05789     };
05790 
05791     inline ITracker& TrackerContext::startRun() {
05792         m_rootTracker = new SectionTracker( "{root}", *this, CATCH_NULL );
05793         m_currentTracker = CATCH_NULL;
05794         m_runState = Executing;
05795         return *m_rootTracker;
05796     }
05797 
05798 } // namespace TestCaseTracking
05799 
05800 using TestCaseTracking::ITracker;
05801 using TestCaseTracking::TrackerContext;
05802 using TestCaseTracking::SectionTracker;
05803 using TestCaseTracking::IndexTracker;
05804 
05805 } // namespace Catch
05806 
05807 // #included from: catch_fatal_condition.hpp
05808 #define TWOBLUECUBES_CATCH_FATAL_CONDITION_H_INCLUDED
05809 
05810 namespace Catch {
05811 
05812     // Report the error condition then exit the process
05813     inline void fatal( std::string const& message, int exitCode ) {
05814         IContext& context = Catch::getCurrentContext();
05815         IResultCapture* resultCapture = context.getResultCapture();
05816         resultCapture->handleFatalErrorCondition( message );
05817 
05818         if( Catch::alwaysTrue() ) // avoids "no return" warnings
05819             exit( exitCode );
05820     }
05821 
05822 } // namespace Catch
05823 
05824 #if defined ( CATCH_PLATFORM_WINDOWS ) /////////////////////////////////////////
05825 
05826 namespace Catch {
05827 
05828     struct FatalConditionHandler {
05829         void reset() {}
05830     };
05831 
05832 } // namespace Catch
05833 
05834 #else // Not Windows - assumed to be POSIX compatible //////////////////////////
05835 
05836 #include <signal.h>
05837 
05838 namespace Catch {
05839 
05840     struct SignalDefs { int id; const char* name; };
05841     extern SignalDefs signalDefs[];
05842     SignalDefs signalDefs[] = {
05843             { SIGINT,  "SIGINT - Terminal interrupt signal" },
05844             { SIGILL,  "SIGILL - Illegal instruction signal" },
05845             { SIGFPE,  "SIGFPE - Floating point error signal" },
05846             { SIGSEGV, "SIGSEGV - Segmentation violation signal" },
05847             { SIGTERM, "SIGTERM - Termination request signal" },
05848             { SIGABRT, "SIGABRT - Abort (abnormal termination) signal" }
05849         };
05850 
05851     struct FatalConditionHandler {
05852 
05853         static void handleSignal( int sig ) {
05854             for( std::size_t i = 0; i < sizeof(signalDefs)/sizeof(SignalDefs); ++i )
05855                 if( sig == signalDefs[i].id )
05856                     fatal( signalDefs[i].name, -sig );
05857             fatal( "<unknown signal>", -sig );
05858         }
05859 
05860         FatalConditionHandler() : m_isSet( true ) {
05861             for( std::size_t i = 0; i < sizeof(signalDefs)/sizeof(SignalDefs); ++i )
05862                 signal( signalDefs[i].id, handleSignal );
05863         }
05864         ~FatalConditionHandler() {
05865             reset();
05866         }
05867         void reset() {
05868             if( m_isSet ) {
05869                 for( std::size_t i = 0; i < sizeof(signalDefs)/sizeof(SignalDefs); ++i )
05870                     signal( signalDefs[i].id, SIG_DFL );
05871                 m_isSet = false;
05872             }
05873         }
05874 
05875         bool m_isSet;
05876     };
05877 
05878 } // namespace Catch
05879 
05880 #endif // not Windows
05881 
05882 #include <set>
05883 #include <string>
05884 
05885 namespace Catch {
05886 
05887     class StreamRedirect {
05888 
05889     public:
05890         StreamRedirect( std::ostream& stream, std::string& targetString )
05891         :   m_stream( stream ),
05892             m_prevBuf( stream.rdbuf() ),
05893             m_targetString( targetString )
05894         {
05895             stream.rdbuf( m_oss.rdbuf() );
05896         }
05897 
05898         ~StreamRedirect() {
05899             m_targetString += m_oss.str();
05900             m_stream.rdbuf( m_prevBuf );
05901         }
05902 
05903     private:
05904         std::ostream& m_stream;
05905         std::streambuf* m_prevBuf;
05906         std::ostringstream m_oss;
05907         std::string& m_targetString;
05908     };
05909 
05911 
05912     class RunContext : public IResultCapture, public IRunner {
05913 
05914         RunContext( RunContext const& );
05915         void operator =( RunContext const& );
05916 
05917     public:
05918 
05919         explicit RunContext( Ptr<IConfig const> const& _config, Ptr<IStreamingReporter> const& reporter )
05920         :   m_runInfo( _config->name() ),
05921             m_context( getCurrentMutableContext() ),
05922             m_activeTestCase( CATCH_NULL ),
05923             m_config( _config ),
05924             m_reporter( reporter )
05925         {
05926             m_context.setRunner( this );
05927             m_context.setConfig( m_config );
05928             m_context.setResultCapture( this );
05929             m_reporter->testRunStarting( m_runInfo );
05930         }
05931 
05932         virtual ~RunContext() {
05933             m_reporter->testRunEnded( TestRunStats( m_runInfo, m_totals, aborting() ) );
05934         }
05935 
05936         void testGroupStarting( std::string const& testSpec, std::size_t groupIndex, std::size_t groupsCount ) {
05937             m_reporter->testGroupStarting( GroupInfo( testSpec, groupIndex, groupsCount ) );
05938         }
05939         void testGroupEnded( std::string const& testSpec, Totals const& totals, std::size_t groupIndex, std::size_t groupsCount ) {
05940             m_reporter->testGroupEnded( TestGroupStats( GroupInfo( testSpec, groupIndex, groupsCount ), totals, aborting() ) );
05941         }
05942 
05943         Totals runTest( TestCase const& testCase ) {
05944             Totals prevTotals = m_totals;
05945 
05946             std::string redirectedCout;
05947             std::string redirectedCerr;
05948 
05949             TestCaseInfo testInfo = testCase.getTestCaseInfo();
05950 
05951             m_reporter->testCaseStarting( testInfo );
05952 
05953             m_activeTestCase = &testCase;
05954 
05955             do {
05956                 m_trackerContext.startRun();
05957                 do {
05958                     m_trackerContext.startCycle();
05959                     m_testCaseTracker = &SectionTracker::acquire( m_trackerContext, testInfo.name );
05960                     runCurrentTest( redirectedCout, redirectedCerr );
05961                 }
05962                 while( !m_testCaseTracker->isSuccessfullyCompleted() && !aborting() );
05963             }
05964             // !TBD: deprecated - this will be replaced by indexed trackers
05965             while( getCurrentContext().advanceGeneratorsForCurrentTest() && !aborting() );
05966 
05967             Totals deltaTotals = m_totals.delta( prevTotals );
05968             if( testInfo.expectedToFail() && deltaTotals.testCases.passed > 0 ) {
05969                 deltaTotals.assertions.failed++;
05970                 deltaTotals.testCases.passed--;
05971                 deltaTotals.testCases.failed++;
05972             }
05973             m_totals.testCases += deltaTotals.testCases;
05974             m_reporter->testCaseEnded( TestCaseStats(   testInfo,
05975                                                         deltaTotals,
05976                                                         redirectedCout,
05977                                                         redirectedCerr,
05978                                                         aborting() ) );
05979 
05980             m_activeTestCase = CATCH_NULL;
05981             m_testCaseTracker = CATCH_NULL;
05982 
05983             return deltaTotals;
05984         }
05985 
05986         Ptr<IConfig const> config() const {
05987             return m_config;
05988         }
05989 
05990     private: // IResultCapture
05991 
05992         virtual void assertionEnded( AssertionResult const& result ) {
05993             if( result.getResultType() == ResultWas::Ok ) {
05994                 m_totals.assertions.passed++;
05995             }
05996             else if( !result.isOk() ) {
05997                 m_totals.assertions.failed++;
05998             }
05999 
06000             if( m_reporter->assertionEnded( AssertionStats( result, m_messages, m_totals ) ) )
06001                 m_messages.clear();
06002 
06003             // Reset working state
06004             m_lastAssertionInfo = AssertionInfo( "", m_lastAssertionInfo.lineInfo, "{Unknown expression after the reported line}" , m_lastAssertionInfo.resultDisposition );
06005             m_lastResult = result;
06006         }
06007 
06008         virtual bool sectionStarted (
06009             SectionInfo const& sectionInfo,
06010             Counts& assertions
06011         )
06012         {
06013             std::ostringstream oss;
06014             oss << sectionInfo.name << "@" << sectionInfo.lineInfo;
06015 
06016             ITracker& sectionTracker = SectionTracker::acquire( m_trackerContext, oss.str() );
06017             if( !sectionTracker.isOpen() )
06018                 return false;
06019             m_activeSections.push_back( &sectionTracker );
06020 
06021             m_lastAssertionInfo.lineInfo = sectionInfo.lineInfo;
06022 
06023             m_reporter->sectionStarting( sectionInfo );
06024 
06025             assertions = m_totals.assertions;
06026 
06027             return true;
06028         }
06029         bool testForMissingAssertions( Counts& assertions ) {
06030             if( assertions.total() != 0 )
06031                 return false;
06032             if( !m_config->warnAboutMissingAssertions() )
06033                 return false;
06034             if( m_trackerContext.currentTracker().hasChildren() )
06035                 return false;
06036             m_totals.assertions.failed++;
06037             assertions.failed++;
06038             return true;
06039         }
06040 
06041         virtual void sectionEnded( SectionEndInfo const& endInfo ) {
06042             Counts assertions = m_totals.assertions - endInfo.prevAssertions;
06043             bool missingAssertions = testForMissingAssertions( assertions );
06044 
06045             if( !m_activeSections.empty() ) {
06046                 m_activeSections.back()->close();
06047                 m_activeSections.pop_back();
06048             }
06049 
06050             m_reporter->sectionEnded( SectionStats( endInfo.sectionInfo, assertions, endInfo.durationInSeconds, missingAssertions ) );
06051             m_messages.clear();
06052         }
06053 
06054         virtual void sectionEndedEarly( SectionEndInfo const& endInfo ) {
06055             if( m_unfinishedSections.empty() )
06056                 m_activeSections.back()->fail();
06057             else
06058                 m_activeSections.back()->close();
06059             m_activeSections.pop_back();
06060 
06061             m_unfinishedSections.push_back( endInfo );
06062         }
06063 
06064         virtual void pushScopedMessage( MessageInfo const& message ) {
06065             m_messages.push_back( message );
06066         }
06067 
06068         virtual void popScopedMessage( MessageInfo const& message ) {
06069             m_messages.erase( std::remove( m_messages.begin(), m_messages.end(), message ), m_messages.end() );
06070         }
06071 
06072         virtual std::string getCurrentTestName() const {
06073             return m_activeTestCase
06074                 ? m_activeTestCase->getTestCaseInfo().name
06075                 : "";
06076         }
06077 
06078         virtual const AssertionResult* getLastResult() const {
06079             return &m_lastResult;
06080         }
06081 
06082         virtual void handleFatalErrorCondition( std::string const& message ) {
06083             ResultBuilder resultBuilder = makeUnexpectedResultBuilder();
06084             resultBuilder.setResultType( ResultWas::FatalErrorCondition );
06085             resultBuilder << message;
06086             resultBuilder.captureExpression();
06087 
06088             handleUnfinishedSections();
06089 
06090             // Recreate section for test case (as we will lose the one that was in scope)
06091             TestCaseInfo const& testCaseInfo = m_activeTestCase->getTestCaseInfo();
06092             SectionInfo testCaseSection( testCaseInfo.lineInfo, testCaseInfo.name, testCaseInfo.description );
06093 
06094             Counts assertions;
06095             assertions.failed = 1;
06096             SectionStats testCaseSectionStats( testCaseSection, assertions, 0, false );
06097             m_reporter->sectionEnded( testCaseSectionStats );
06098 
06099             TestCaseInfo testInfo = m_activeTestCase->getTestCaseInfo();
06100 
06101             Totals deltaTotals;
06102             deltaTotals.testCases.failed = 1;
06103             m_reporter->testCaseEnded( TestCaseStats(   testInfo,
06104                                                         deltaTotals,
06105                                                         "",
06106                                                         "",
06107                                                         false ) );
06108             m_totals.testCases.failed++;
06109             testGroupEnded( "", m_totals, 1, 1 );
06110             m_reporter->testRunEnded( TestRunStats( m_runInfo, m_totals, false ) );
06111         }
06112 
06113     public:
06114         // !TBD We need to do this another way!
06115         bool aborting() const {
06116             return m_totals.assertions.failed == static_cast<std::size_t>( m_config->abortAfter() );
06117         }
06118 
06119     private:
06120 
06121         void runCurrentTest( std::string& redirectedCout, std::string& redirectedCerr ) {
06122             TestCaseInfo const& testCaseInfo = m_activeTestCase->getTestCaseInfo();
06123             SectionInfo testCaseSection( testCaseInfo.lineInfo, testCaseInfo.name, testCaseInfo.description );
06124             m_reporter->sectionStarting( testCaseSection );
06125             Counts prevAssertions = m_totals.assertions;
06126             double duration = 0;
06127             try {
06128                 m_lastAssertionInfo = AssertionInfo( "TEST_CASE", testCaseInfo.lineInfo, "", ResultDisposition::Normal );
06129 
06130                 seedRng( *m_config );
06131 
06132                 Timer timer;
06133                 timer.start();
06134                 if( m_reporter->getPreferences().shouldRedirectStdOut ) {
06135                     StreamRedirect coutRedir( Catch::cout(), redirectedCout );
06136                     StreamRedirect cerrRedir( Catch::cerr(), redirectedCerr );
06137                     invokeActiveTestCase();
06138                 }
06139                 else {
06140                     invokeActiveTestCase();
06141                 }
